utterances.speaker: ANDY COHEN, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Thanks for a great year this year. Thanks for keeping them honest.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: To all of you who are at home, who are toasting along with us, we wish you a very happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year, everybody.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I think it's getting easier. I think it's going down better. By the way, I just want to point out that --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Why do people do this?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I made a big effort. We waved at Seacrest. He saw us waving to him.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: So, he cannot go around saying that I dissed him --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Don't -- all right, don't start. Don't even mention --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I'm not starting. I'm just keeping it real clean. We have waved, connection has been made.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: We complimented his outfit. He looked great. He's in a very nice tux.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.OK, our next guest does it all. She is a comedian, actress, singer, writer --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: He's stirring the pot. This is Andy stirring the pot.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Not really, just keeping it clean. I'm keeping my side of the street clean.This year, she starred in a HBO series that has made a lot of best of list. It's called "Somebody Somewhere".

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh, so good. COHENHey, Everett.

utterances.speaker: BRIDGET EVERETT, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Hi.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: How are you doing? You look beautiful.What did you bring with you?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: I just brought -- this is like a beta blocker for women over 50. I will put it right here so I don't lose it.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: This is family-friendly tonight, right?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh, yeah.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah, it's a family show.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Nothing says family-friendly like you --(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: We'll answer that question after we get through with you.Bridget, what was your rose and thorn of '23?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Well, I think of my thorn was my mom died, and that was a little bummer --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What was your mom's name?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: But my rose --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What was her name?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Freddie (ph).

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Freddie?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Freddie, yeah.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: She looked amazing from Instagram, all the pictures.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Freddie is like -- she's the beaver tail queen, and we will get to that later.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: But anyway, short story log, my rose is actually being my here tonight with you guys.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: No, this is so iconic. It's -- iconic -- I sound like a Kardashian. But this is so cool, all these people here, and to be here and have access to a bathroom, I mean, come on --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that's the cake.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You have access to a bathroom?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You have access?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: I'm not even wearing a diaper. I just went on the street.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: But you never have been in Times Square on New Year's Eve like a lot of New Yorkers? Like a guy hadn't either.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: No, no, I've lived here for 25 years, I never have done this before. It's exciting.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Congratulations to "Somebody Somewhere".

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: It's been picked up for a third season on HBO. What can we expect for next season?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: A lot of love, no nudity, safe for the family, lots of tender moments. You know, I think it's a good time and it's 100 percent on "Rotten Tomatoes". So --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: There you go, wow.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I saw you -- we saw you together at Joe's Pub a couple of year, it was the -- you were so funny, you're so talented.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Anderson.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah, it's nice to see people getting to know you through the HBO show because a lot of people didn't know you?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Well, I think like, you know, with anything, anytime you start to open your heart and just sort of let it go, whether it's downtown or Joe's Pub, sort of, motorboating (ph) people, you know, on HBO, and sort of having more tender moments. I think it's a great way to share your heart.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I have had the privilege of being motor-boated (ph) by you several times, I have to say, and I cherish those experiences.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: It's a New York right of passage.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is. And, by the way, shout-out to Joe's Pub because Sandra Bernhardt is performing there tonight. We saw her last night. It is absolutely wonderful.We lost Peewee Herman this year.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You posted about getting to know him. What is your favorite memory you have of Paul Reubens?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Well, my friend Murray Hill was good friends with him so we all went to dinner one night with my friend Michael Patrick King and Craig, and we just sat around and he is such a legend. And he was so personal. On my 50th birthday, he sent a video that was very thoughtful and tender and sweet.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I heard he did that for people. I used to get Christmas and thanksgiving cards from him, which were hilarious.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: I got the Christmas cards, yeah.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh, yeah.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: But I know from people he really cared about it in wanted to connect with, he would send these very emotional videos.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: He did. It was just like, I believe in you. I think you're this. I think you're special. Hearing that from somebody like him who is a legendary and has really paved his own way was -- it really moved me.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I think also the fact that he knew we had this diagnosis, it clearly affected the way that he lived his life. And what he put out there. And it's so touching to see how many people he touched in the last few years of his life. I mean, certainly for his whole life.But let me switch gears because I want to talk of one of my favorite songs in your cabaret. And it is New Year's Eve in a lot of people are celebrating breasts tonight.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Why not? We should celebrate breasts because that's what we eat -- we start our life, with those.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Anderson is going to have hard hitting -- I can see the, word right? COHEN

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Hard-hitting tiddies.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Because you both have the silver daddy tiddies.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Or the zaddy (ph) tiddies, you got Ramona from the housewives, she has those turtle times. You have my mom who got the beaver tails. I don't know. I could keep going but everybody has different shapes and sizes in their all something to celebrate, right?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I love it. Now, you have prepared a little special something for Anderson. Let me get on. Let me just switch spots with you. You love Anderson. You love Anderson.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: I do. Everybody loves Anderson.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: This right now, I've gotten this close to me. So you are all mine.Anderson, I wrote a song for you.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Oh, did you write it?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't write it but I should have because it's perfect.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Who wrote it?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: You know, new direction.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: One Direction.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Hold on, I got to block my beta real quick. People say hit the track but there is no tracks because I'm going to sing a cappella. I know you got to get -- there is a more important guests coming on.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: No, we got nowhere to go.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: We've got nowhere to go.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: We've got four hours.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: All right. It's going to start, just keep your hands in your pocket, let's not touch yet. It's That's too much. I fall over this railing. Are you ready? Unless you want to hold hands.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I'm ready.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Okay, we'll get to it. Hit the track.There is another song going. It's okay I'll make it work. Close your eyes. You're insecure, don't know what for, you're turnin' heads when you walk through the door, don't need makeup to cover up, baby the way that you are is enough. Everyone else in the room can see it. Everyone else but you. Baby, you light up my world like nobody else. The way that you flip your hair gets me overwhelmed. When I'm looking at you I can't believe you don't know. I sing a little too high.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It's all right.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: You don't know your beautiful. If only you could see what I could see, you'd understand why I love you so desperately. Right now I'm looking at you and I can't believe. You don't know. You don't know you're beautiful. That's what makes you beautiful.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Anderson, you are beautiful and you don't know it.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: You don't know it, but now you do.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Andy probably here to tell you.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Thank you for telling me. Wow.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You are vessel for my emotion.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: If you want to be here with you all night, I can stay.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I would love that.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I have to give it up to Bridget because the moment she started singing, some god awful song is playing over there and she saying. That is so hard to single another song is going. That was great. Good job.

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: Hard to hear here in Times Square. You guys, I love it here, happy New Year's everybody. This is the best night of my life. Cheers!

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Where are you headed right now?

utterances.speaker: EVERETT
utterances.sentences: I'm not going anywhere. I'm staying here. Is that weird? I didn't wear makeup so that we could have cattle bells.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah, sure. COHENYes, take a picture of these two.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: We have an actual photographer.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: We asked some of your favorite celebrities what their resolutions are for 2024, and here is what they had to say.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JULIA ROBERTS, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution is to watch more Bravo TV shows.

utterances.speaker: MAREN MORRIS, SINGER
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution is to stop apologizing so much.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM NORTON, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: I resolve not to drink this year. Oh.

utterances.speaker: JOHN MAYER, SINGER
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution for 2024 is to think a little less about artificial intelligence and what it might mean for the future, and think more about humanity and connecting with humans and finding out more about what we're all capable of.

utterances.speaker: ISSA RAE, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution is always just to do more and be better. But next year, I really want to read more. I did not read books and it is (EXPLETIVE DELETED) me up.

utterances.speaker: MATT ROGERS, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: This year, my New Year's resolution is I'm going to go to the gym and not workout, just pick up guys there.

utterances.speaker: SARAH SHERMAN, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution is to meditate every day.

utterances.speaker: KRISTEN STEWART, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: I think I need to start having New Year's resolutions. I think that might be my resolution.

utterances.speaker: REBA MCENTIRE, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: I am going to have a blast. I'm going to have more fun than the years before. I'm going to be a happy camper.

utterances.speaker: RITA ORA, SINGER
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution would be to protect my space.

utterances.speaker: TOM BLYTH, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: My New Year's resolution is to get more sleep.

utterances.speaker: YVONNE ORJI, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: To apologize more. Yeah. That's a good one. Because I'm never wrong.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Wow. What was that? What did you say? COHEN

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Nicki Minaj.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Who is he referring to?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: The bitches.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I don't know --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I'll tell you later.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Tell me in the break.Up next, magic with David Blaine from his new show "Impossible" at the Encore Theater at Wynn Las Vegas.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You're so beautiful -- you are so beautiful, Anderson.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Plus of performance from Darius Rucker.We'll be right back from Times Square. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: DAVID BLAINE, MAGICIAN
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year, Anderson and Andy. Nice to see you. COHENremember reading you did an 80-foot jump during one of your shows. You wound up dislocating or shoulder. How are you able to pop it back in? And did you continue your show?

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: I did continue the show because the show must go on but I promise when you come I will not do the same thing. We will be okay.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I know you are drinking a lot of water for something you're going to be doing. Can you share about your new residency, "Impossible," at the Wynn? What's it like? What should people expect?

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: It's amazing to be here.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: By the way, he's drinking a lot of water to prepare for this trick he's about to do, y'all.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: No, I'm in the desert. I'm drinking a lot of water because it's dry in the desert, so everything is --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So, what should people expect on your show?

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: But the truth is the show is called "Impossible", but it is because it is a very interactive show. So, it is an intimate move, so it's pretty exciting for me to be able to meet all the people and move around the theater and do all kinds of new magic.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: This is your first time ever performing on New Year's eve. Besides what you are about to do live for us on CNN, do you any special surprises planned for the crowd that will be there in Vegas?

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: I have a fun show tonight, for sure. I'll try something you guys, okay? So, I don't know if you can see all the cards in the deck. You can see how they're different, yeah?I'm going to run through the cards and I want you to try to see what is inside. It might not the ace of hearts but try to see one inside if you can. Can you see one?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: Are you thinking of one?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: Wait but you guys -- hold one, but you guys are drinking this year, huh?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: A little bit.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Every hour.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: I brought a drink also. We can do a shot together.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Okay. That's kerosene, oh, boy, oh, God, this can't be good.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yikes.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: OK.What is going to happen here? Okay. Whoa! What? Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: That was my card!

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: That was my card, too!

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: How is that possible?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: How is that possible?  He's got more.OK. Let it all out. Yeah, let it out, purge it. Let it go. Wow.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Wow, how is that possible?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: That was unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: That was unbelievable. That was amazing, four of clubs!

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, how is that possible?That's nuts. I don't understand that.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You just sold a lot of tickets to a residency, I will tell you that much because that really blew me away.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I understand, Emma Stone must of revealed a couple weeks ago.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: I'm very excited to see you --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: She was so impressed by a magic tricky, did she ran out of the room and slipped and broke her shoulder. Did you ever talk to her after that accident?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Not the shoulder --

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: I did. That is not the type of reaction I would usually respond to, though.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: That's understandable. But, listen, people respond in their own ways.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And I love the video of you and Harrison ford. That's just incredible.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: That was amazing.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: David, thank you so much. Have a great show tonight. We can't wait to see your show in Vegas. Thank you, David Blaine.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Thanks for a great trick. I love that.

utterances.speaker: BLAINE
utterances.sentences: Nice to see you both, happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Welcome back.I'm sorry. My mind was elsewhere.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: OK. Next, the one and only Henry Winkler.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I'm so excited, Henry Winkler. I'm so --

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Live on his big year.But, first, a special message about the NHL Winter Classic happening tomorrow on New York's Day. Anderson's been talking about it all day.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Let's talk a look.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HENRIK LUNDQVIST, RETIRED NHL PLAYER
utterances.sentences: Hey, Anderson and Andy, I want to wish you and everyone else around the world a happy New Year. The puck drops on New Year's Day with the NHL Winter Classic. Let's plan to watch together on TNT and Max. Cheers!(END VIDEO CLIP) (COMMERCIAL BREAK) (MUSIC) [21:27:03] COHEN: From "Happy Days" to his Emmy-winning role on HBO's "Barry", Henry Winkler is an American icon. He has a new memoir out, "Being Henry: The Fonz and Beyond", about his five decades in Hollywood, and his struggles with dyslexia. It just hit eight weeks on "The New York Times" bestsellers list. I loved it.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It's a great book.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Henry is joining us now know, from someplace a lot warmer than here, Hawaii.Hey, look at him.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: On shades, no less.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Wow, the Fonz in Hawaii.

utterances.speaker: HENRY WINKLER, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: It is a pleasure. And I feel guilty than I am not bundled up.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It's all right.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I'm happy for you, Henry. I mean --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.So, what's your plan for tonight in Hawaii?

utterances.speaker: WINKLER
utterances.sentences: The whole family is here, 14 strong. And we are going to have dinner from 2 to 78.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Wow, love it.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I love it.I love your memoir, Henry. And I love how much you featured your wife Stacey, who's a good buddy of mine. You two just celebrated your 45th anniversary this year. What do you think is a secret to a long-lasting marriage like the two of you have.

utterances.speaker: WINKKLER
utterances.sentences: Two things. One is will. The other is listening.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Also, you know, in your memoir, you wrote about what a breakout character Fonzie was. You and I have talked about this over the years. I loved the Fonz as a kid. I was the Fonz for fourth grade on Halloween. I didn't know that were real cream, I put Vaseline in my hair and my hair was greasy for like a month and I was made fun of.I have Fonzie sheets. I wrote you letters. I wrote you fan letters. The network I understand from reading your book wanted to change the name of "Happy Days" to Fonzie's happy days because it was such an iconic character, and you are against thjat. Talk about that dynamic. Why were you so against that idea?

utterances.speaker: WINKLER
utterances.sentences: The Fonz was very successful because I got to live with that group of people, with that family. And why fix something that isn't broken? It would've been a slap in the face to every member of my family. If we called it Fonzie's happy days, instead of the "Happy Days" it was.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Henry, I got to -- you shot the series finale of "Barry" this year. Were you happy with how it all ended?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Wow, wow.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And "Happy Days" is going to celebrate its 50th anniversary in 2024. Have you -- I mean, have you talked to Ron Howard and the rest of the gang about doing something special for it? I mean, people still love -- it is still beloved by people.

utterances.speaker: WINKLER
utterances.sentences: You know what? So far we have only talked together. We were with Marian on Zoom and they are still very much a family. Sometimes you do a show, it is over, you think you've been friends for so long and everybody moves on. But the "Happy Days" cast has stayed very close.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Henry, you have been in over 100 TV shows and movies.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: I want to play a quick round of, was Winkler in it? I'm going to present Anderson with a project. He has to guess whether you are in there or not. And then you will reveal.Anderson, was Henry an episode of the Bob Newhart show?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I would believe that.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Henry?

utterances.speaker: WINKLER
